text.div:
SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/103)

Mapping from http://snomed.info/sct?fhir_vs to http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 2012-06-13 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0

Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna


Source Code Relationship Destination Code Comment
263204007 (Fracture of shaft of ulna) maps to narrower target S52.209A The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is 'source-is-broader-than-target', since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
maps to narrower target S52.209D The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is 'source-is-broader-than-target', since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is 'source-is-broader-than-target', since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
